FindingName: MFA Not Required for Security Information Registration
Description: No Conditional Access Policies were found that enforce the use of multi-factor authentication when registering user security information/options with the tenant. Configuring and requiring multi-factor authentication for security information registration can aid in preventing compromised user credentials from being used to associate unauthorized multi-factor options with a user's account.
Remediation: Create Conditional Access Policies that enforces multi-factor authentication when registering user security information/options with Azure Active Directory. Navigate to Azure Active Directory/Microsoft Entra → Navigate to Conditional Access (Security → Conditional Access in Azure Active Directory/Protect & Secure → Conditional Access in Microsoft Entra) → Select '+ New Policy' → Select Users → 'All Users' → Select 'Cloud apps or actions' → change the dropdown to 'User Actions' → Select 'Register security information' → Select 'Grant Controls' → Select 'Require multifactor authentication' (alternatively, select 'Require authentication strength' and configure the required strength levels) → Change the 'Enable policy' value to 'On' → Select 'Create'.
